spass

Class Spass

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • spass.Spass
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, NumberListener

    public class Spass
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, NumberListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    Structured illumination Pattern Analyzer (and Stripe Slicer). Analyzes images of Structured Illumination Microscopy (SIM), to find the parameters of the structured illumination. TODO: Cut stripes out of the images and compose them to an resolution enhanced image. (my Bachelor-Thesis)
    Author:
    Oliver Eickmeyer
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • updateTrafoDisplay

        public void updateTrafoDisplay()

      • createSIPattern

        public static double[] createSIPattern(int size,
                                       double angle,
                                       double phase,
                                       double wavelength)
        Generates a quadratic SI pattern of the given size, and with the given SI parameters. The values will be stored in an one-dimensional array, index of each element calculated with i = y * size + x.
        Parameters:
        size - - size of the quadratic pattern in one dimension
        angle - - angle of the SI pattern (in radians)
        phase - - phase of the SI pattern (in pixels)
        wavelength - - wavelength of the SI pattern (in pixels)
        Returns:
        array containing the values of the SI pattern

      • createMask

        public static boolean[] createMask(int size)
        Creates a boolean array for the purpose of masking the transform array. This is helpful to make the interesting parts of the sectra more visible. So far only the point 0, 0 is masked (because this is in every transform usually the 'brightest').
        Parameters:
        size - size of the quadratic array (in one dimension)
        Returns:
        boolean array
